page.title: 01Fulbeck & Caythorpe Heaths
page.content: Clay soil agricultural heath growing cereals/sugar beet/oilseed rape/ potatoes with sheep rearing on secondary crops & crop residues. The large fields have boundaries of hedges or low stone walls. Maiden House Farm, Fulbeck & Mill Farm Caythorpe are centres of agri-industries & include drying & storage facilities. At the eastern end of the block is part of the RAF college, Cranwell. This includes the college building, & sports & lecture areas. The swimming pool & Whittle Hall theatre are some- times available to local clubs for public use. The cafe at Byards Leap draws some trade from the A17 trunk road, but most of the garage's trade is local & associated with Cranwell. The trunk road is much used by commercial traffic.
